content.question:
<math alttext="X gas plus Y gas is in equilibrium with X Y gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>Y(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mo>â‡„</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>XY(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

The particle diagrams above show the changes that occurred after an equimolecular mixture of <math alttext="X gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Y gas" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> was placed inside a rigid container at constant temperature. Which of the following statements is be best supported by the particle diagrams?

choices.label: The rate of the reverse reaction is zero because the concentration of <math alttext="X Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>XY</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> keeps increasing.

The reverse reaction has a higher rate than the forward reaction between <math alttext="200 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>200</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="300 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because <math alttext="the molar concentration of X Y is significantly greater than the molar concentration of X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>[XY]>>[X]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The forward reaction has a faster rate than the reverse reaction between <math alttext="0 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="300 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because more products were being formed.

The rates of the forward and reverse reactions were the same after <math alttext="100 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because the rate of formation of <math alttext="X Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>XY</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> was constant.

content.answer: The forward reaction has a faster rate than the reverse reaction between <math alttext="0 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="300 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because more products were being formed.

skill.text: 4.D: Explain the degree to which a model or representation describes the connection between particulate-level properties and macroscopic properties.
